class UnbufferedServer[source]

UnbufferedServer(server_address, RequestHandlerClass, bind_and_activate=True) :: ThreadingHTTPServer

A ThreadingHTTPServer that disables output buffering, for more convenient logging

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Python's HTTPServer (and subclasses) call methods called do_{HTTPMETHOD}, e.g. do_GET, do_POST, etc, in a BaseHTTPRequestHandler subclass that you pass in to its constructor. For instance:

{% raw %} 
class _TestHandler(BaseHTTPRequestHandler):
    def do_GET(self):
        self.send_response(200)
        self.end_headers()
        self.wfile.write(b'ok')

@threaded
def _test_server():
    with UnbufferedServer(('localhost',8000), _TestHandler) as httpd: httpd.handle_request()
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
_test_server()
time.sleep(0.1) # wait for server to start
test_eq(urlread("http://localhost:8000"), b'ok')

Listening on ('127.0.0.1', 8000)

127.0.0.1 - - [11/Oct/2020 13:58:17] "GET / HTTP/1.1" 200 -
{% endraw %}

run_server[source]

run_server(hostname:"Host name or IP"='localhost', port:"Port to listen on"=8000, debug:"If True, do not trigger actions, just print"=False, inifile:"Path to settings ini file"='twitter.ini', check_ip:"Check source IP against GitHub list"=True, single_request=False)

Run a GitHub webhook server that tweets about new releases

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
time.sleep(0.5) # wait for previous server to stop
threaded(partial(run_server, check_ip=False, debug=True, single_request=True))()

<Thread(Thread-6, started 140112752244480)>

Installer

{% raw %}

fastwebhook_install_service[source]

fastwebhook_install_service(hostname:"Host name or IP"='0.0.0.0', port:"Port to listen on"=8000, inifile:"Path to settings ini file"='twitter.ini', check_ip:"Check source IP against GitHub list"=True, service_path:"Directory to write service file to"='/etc/systemd/system/')

Install fastwebhook as a service

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

This fastcore.script CLI installs fastwebhook as a systemd service. Run fastwebhook_install_service --help in your terminal for options.
